item.title: Cruyff brand websites
item.description: The Cruyff brand sites are closely related: clearly part of the same family but different in character. The framework, functionality and UX of the sites all have the characteristic Cruyff blend of international style, sport and luxury. The content, however is tailored towards either sport and innovation or towards style and as we call it 'football' luxury.
item.content:encoded: The Cruyff brand sites are closely related: clearly part of the same family but different in character. The framework, functionality and UX of the sites all have the characteristic Cruyff blend of international style, sport and luxury. The content, however is tailored towards either sport and innovation or towards style and as we call it 'football' luxury.

item.title: Zetland House Signage
item.description: Zetland House is a unique and striking warehouse-style office property, situated in the heart of Shoreditch, London. The building was originally a Print Works for The Bank of England. Today, it has been refurbished with modern businesses in mind, whilst maintaining its existing structure and original period features. Bunch was invited to devise a new signage system and update the original branding. Inspired by almost extinct ghost signs from the surrounding area, the new signage looks both contemporary and familiar. In close collaboration with Nicolai Sclater, an East London traditional signwriter, original designs were drawn by hand and applied directly to the walls, onto everything from large scale signage, external and internal way finding and courier signs. Bunch would like to acknowledge the invaluable help given to us by Adam J. Evans/Ordinary
item.content:encoded: Zetland House is a unique and striking warehouse-style office property, situated in the heart of Shoreditch, London. The building was originally a Print Works for The Bank of England. Today, it has been refurbished with modern businesses in mind, whilst maintaining its existing structure and original period features. Bunch was invited to devise a new signage system and update the original branding. Inspired by almost extinct ghost signs from the surrounding area, the new signage looks both contemporary and familiar. In close collaboration with Nicolai Sclater, an East London traditional signwriter, original designs were drawn by hand and applied directly to the walls, onto everything from large scale signage, external and internal way finding and courier signs. Bunch would like to acknowledge the invaluable help given to us by Adam J. Evans/Ordinary

item.title: Three sleeping king
item.description: It is a graphic triptych of dreams. If you imagine the dream as a tape that surrounds the sleeping king and transforms his world. No color, only black and white graphics and the rhythm of the images and illusions. Reflections on a whisper of waves in the coming nights. When twilight and the king did not respond to the world. When before the dreamer opens a world where he is the true king. No more, no less. Where the Wild Things Are drowning in the waves of the ocean. There, where the waves of the ocean produces monsters.
item.content:encoded: It is a graphic triptych of dreams. If you imagine the dream as a tape that surrounds the sleeping king and transforms his world. No color, only black and white graphics and the rhythm of the images and illusions. Reflections on a whisper of waves in the coming nights. When twilight and the king did not respond to the world. When before the dreamer opens a world where he is the true king. No more, no less. Where the Wild Things Are drowning in the waves of the ocean. There, where the waves of the ocean produces monsters.

item.title: Doce Cielos
item.description: Doce Cielos is a brand specializing in traditional handcrafted honey-based products. Their mission is to encourage the recognition and consumption of these native Mexican apiculture products, emphasizing the products richness in flavor, texture, color and benefits to personal health. The packaging lines make allusion to traditional handcrafted Mexican paintings and art pieces. Our proposal achieves a sophisticated link between the Mexican handcrafts heritage and the honeys sweet traditional essence. Since the brands primary products are honey-based, we chose a bee for the logo. The packaging design praises the great variety of honey varieties using a categorization based visual system and nomenclature. The typography is meant to convey the cleanliness and elegance of the product.
item.content:encoded: Doce Cielos is a brand specializing in traditional handcrafted honey-based products. Their mission is to encourage the recognition and consumption of these native Mexican apiculture products, emphasizing the products richness in flavor, texture, color and benefits to personal health. The packaging lines make allusion to traditional handcrafted Mexican paintings and art pieces. Our proposal achieves a sophisticated link between the Mexican handcrafts heritage and the honeys sweet traditional essence. Since the brands primary products are honey-based, we chose a bee for the logo. The packaging design praises the great variety of honey varieties using a categorization based visual system and nomenclature. The typography is meant to convey the cleanliness and elegance of the product.

item.title: PNC Bank - "S" is for Saving
item.description: Agencies Razorfish and Bernstein & Andriuli requested us to do the Art Direction of PCN Banks new website, dedicated exclusively to children. The idea consisted in developing a graphic platform to teach children about the concept of "saving". As we love what our friends from Bosque Studio do, we worked together with them to develop the art of all games and sections. We had a lot of fun and the result is a lovely web, full of joy, colours and beautiful characters. Enjoy it!
item.content:encoded: Agencies Razorfish and Bernstein & Andriuli requested us to do the Art Direction of PCN Banks new website, dedicated exclusively to children. The idea consisted in developing a graphic platform to teach children about the concept of "saving". As we love what our friends from Bosque Studio do, we worked together with them to develop the art of all games and sections. We had a lot of fun and the result is a lovely web, full of joy, colours and beautiful characters. Enjoy it!

item.title: In Pursuit of the Question Mark
item.description: Exhibition graphics, Invitation and Catalogue for George Wyllie MBE first major retrospective, who sadly passed away in the early part of 2012. In Pursuit of the Question Mark a retrospect of the work of George Wyllie is open to the public from 3rd November 2012 2 February 2013 at The Mitchell, North Street, Glasgow. George Wyllie was a prolific figure in the arts who worked in regenerative, performance and public Art. Throughout his lifetime he exhibited in the UK, Europe, India and the USA, and his monumental sculptures are permanently installed in urban settings across the globe. The overall feel of the Catalogue and other related material was closely aligned with his beliefs and process's as an Artist, Thinker and Scul?tor. Influenced by his robust use of materials and unfinished approach to his work. The Catalogues are limited editions including a bespoke hand stamp and signed by a numbering system.
item.content:encoded: Exhibition graphics, Invitation and Catalogue for George Wyllie MBE first major retrospective, who sadly passed away in the early part of 2012. In Pursuit of the Question Mark a retrospect of the work of George Wyllie is open to the public from 3rd November 2012 2 February 2013 at The Mitchell, North Street, Glasgow. George Wyllie was a prolific figure in the arts who worked in regenerative, performance and public Art. Throughout his lifetime he exhibited in the UK, Europe, India and the USA, and his monumental sculptures are permanently installed in urban settings across the globe. The overall feel of the Catalogue and other related material was closely aligned with his beliefs and process's as an Artist, Thinker and Scul?tor. Influenced by his robust use of materials and unfinished approach to his work. The Catalogues are limited editions including a bespoke hand stamp and signed by a numbering system.

item.title: The Underwater Project
item.description: Grip the sand, they remind themselves. Go low, stay low. Their faces contort, their muscles tighten in reaction to the struggle for power with the ocean. They surface when the surge has passed. Then breathe. They are unaware that a camera has captured it all; from straining arms clawing at sand to eyes squeezed shut against the bite of salt. Mark Tipple holds his camera steady in the melting foam, and makes his way to shore. Surf photographys been around forever. I wanted something different.
item.content:encoded: Grip the sand, they remind themselves. Go low, stay low. Their faces contort, their muscles tighten in reaction to the struggle for power with the ocean. They surface when the surge has passed. Then breathe. They are unaware that a camera has captured it all; from straining arms clawing at sand to eyes squeezed shut against the bite of salt. Mark Tipple holds his camera steady in the melting foam, and makes his way to shore. Surf photographys been around forever. I wanted something different.

item.title: MELODY® NESCAFÉ® Dolce Gusto®
item.description: For the release of the new Nescafé Dolce Gusto coffee machine Melody, the parisian art galerie L'Imprimerie and Nescafé decided to collaborate and asked french artists to customize the machine thanks to their own special talents. I was asked to do so and I chose to cover it with plasticine turning it into a funny and sweet creature. You're invited to see the artwork exhibited at the galerie L'Imprimerie, 16 rue St Merri, 75004 Event invented by Waf Agency
item.content:encoded: For the release of the new Nescafé Dolce Gusto coffee machine Melody, the parisian art galerie L'Imprimerie and Nescafé decided to collaborate and asked french artists to customize the machine thanks to their own special talents. I was asked to do so and I chose to cover it with plasticine turning it into a funny and sweet creature. You're invited to see the artwork exhibited at the galerie L'Imprimerie, 16 rue St Merri, 75004 Event invented by Waf Agency

item.title: President's Design Award 2012
item.description: The Presidents Design Award 2012 is Singapores most prestigious design accolade. Established in 2006, the Award recognises excellence across all design disciplines, including advertising design and visual communications, architecture and urban design, fashion design, furniture design, interior design, landscape design, product and industrial design. In its seventh year, the Presidents Design Award represents the pinnacle of recognition in Singapores design sector. It honours the significant achievements and contributions of the nations design talents and is awarded to designers who have pushed the envelope to make a significant difference to the community through design that improves the quality of life. Their contributions should have also enhanced human potential and national competitiveness, moving beyond mere aesthetics. The Presidents Design Award is presented in two categories Designer of the Year and Design of the Year. So far, a total of 20 Designers of the Year (two in 2011 and 2010, four in 2009, three in 2008, seven in 2007 and two in 2006) and 47 Designs of the Year (ten in 2011, nine in 2010, seven each year in 2009, 2008, 2007 and 2006) have been conferred the Award. An appointed panel of expert jurors from both Singapore and overseas will assess potential Award candidates. Recipients of the Award will receive a trophy and a certificate. All Award recipients will receive their award at the Presidents Design Award Ceremony in December 2012 and be featured in a Presidents Design Award publication and exhibition. The Award is conferred by the President of the Republic of Singapore, and is jointly administered by DesignSingapore Council and Urban Redevelopment Authority.
item.content:encoded: The Presidents Design Award 2012 is Singapores most prestigious design accolade. Established in 2006, the Award recognises excellence across all design disciplines, including advertising design and visual communications, architecture and urban design, fashion design, furniture design, interior design, landscape design, product and industrial design. In its seventh year, the Presidents Design Award represents the pinnacle of recognition in Singapores design sector. It honours the significant achievements and contributions of the nations design talents and is awarded to designers who have pushed the envelope to make a significant difference to the community through design that improves the quality of life. Their contributions should have also enhanced human potential and national competitiveness, moving beyond mere aesthetics. The Presidents Design Award is presented in two categories Designer of the Year and Design of the Year. So far, a total of 20 Designers of the Year (two in 2011 and 2010, four in 2009, three in 2008, seven in 2007 and two in 2006) and 47 Designs of the Year (ten in 2011, nine in 2010, seven each year in 2009, 2008, 2007 and 2006) have been conferred the Award. An appointed panel of expert jurors from both Singapore and overseas will assess potential Award candidates. Recipients of the Award will receive a trophy and a certificate. All Award recipients will receive their award at the Presidents Design Award Ceremony in December 2012 and be featured in a Presidents Design Award publication and exhibition. The Award is conferred by the President of the Republic of Singapore, and is jointly administered by DesignSingapore Council and Urban Redevelopment Authority.

item.title: PALOMA music complex in Nîmes
item.description: Situated in southern France, Nîmes is well known for its exuberant character, its fashionable artists and..... its tumultuous/spectacular storms. Tetrarc has fed on Nîmes special identity in order to create the complex dedicated to contemporary music that has just been opened at the entrance to the town between a flying club and a district made up of a mix of low rise buildings, houses and small local businesses. Given the name Paloma, the complex consists of two concert halls, twelve rehearsal and recording studios, six accommodation areas for the performers in residence, administration offices and the all-important technical facilities. Tetrarc has devised a tonic form which springs out from the ground and flows out towards the sky and the town as if some powerful internal forces are pushing at its walls and are threatening to shatter them. This zinc shell actually stretches, frays, even tears apart in some parts in order to display like a supernatural eye the giant screen which announces performances and artists. This is also an internal event. Viewing the concert as a confrontation between artists and public, Tetrarc uses the colours of the bullfight (yellow and purple) for the foyer, the stairs and the patio; red in the foyers at the entrance to the two halls; the geometry of the bullfighters movements are represented by the congealed textures on the walls of the hall; images of a crowd seated in an arena are projected onto the seats in the big hall. The walls of this hall display a giant sculpture whose material evokes the sleekness of the picadors hair, and whose form evokes a gigantic cog like the one grinding the men in Charlie Chaplins Modern Times. For Tetrarc, the architecture is at the confluence of artistic expression. There is an echo of the cinema of Spielberg and Chaplin. The visual arts are a feature of the foyer conceived like a penetrable sculpture opened out into the interior space of the shell as well as the small hall, the studios and the performers restaurant which plays tribute to abstract geometric art, whilst the big repetitive stripes on the patio evoke the work of the Support-Surface group, a well known presence in Nîmes. The design is linked to the music roots evident in the choice of vintage furnishings redolent of the 1960s in the restaurant and the performers apartments. Culturally rich, Tetrarcs project has also been retained in the precision of its planning: the different entrances (public, administration, performers, materials) are clearly separated; the halls are served directly from the vast foyer opening onto the patio, the sales area for associated products, the cloakroom and the radio studio; the three stages are directly connected and on the level of a single loading bay for the lorries that supply the equipment... and the activity on the floor of the immense concrete square draws the eyes of the storm towards the big retention pond. After The Factory in Nantes, Tetrarc is diving into its rocker past to make Paloma rock.
item.content:encoded: Situated in southern France, Nîmes is well known for its exuberant character, its fashionable artists and..... its tumultuous/spectacular storms. Tetrarc has fed on Nîmes special identity in order to create the complex dedicated to contemporary music that has just been opened at the entrance to the town between a flying club and a district made up of a mix of low rise buildings, houses and small local businesses. Given the name Paloma, the complex consists of two concert halls, twelve rehearsal and recording studios, six accommodation areas for the performers in residence, administration offices and the all-important technical facilities. Tetrarc has devised a tonic form which springs out from the ground and flows out towards the sky and the town as if some powerful internal forces are pushing at its walls and are threatening to shatter them. This zinc shell actually stretches, frays, even tears apart in some parts in order to display like a supernatural eye the giant screen which announces performances and artists. This is also an internal event. Viewing the concert as a confrontation between artists and public, Tetrarc uses the colours of the bullfight (yellow and purple) for the foyer, the stairs and the patio; red in the foyers at the entrance to the two halls; the geometry of the bullfighters movements are represented by the congealed textures on the walls of the hall; images of a crowd seated in an arena are projected onto the seats in the big hall. The walls of this hall display a giant sculpture whose material evokes the sleekness of the picadors hair, and whose form evokes a gigantic cog like the one grinding the men in Charlie Chaplins Modern Times. For Tetrarc, the architecture is at the confluence of artistic expression. There is an echo of the cinema of Spielberg and Chaplin. The visual arts are a feature of the foyer conceived like a penetrable sculpture opened out into the interior space of the shell as well as the small hall, the studios and the performers restaurant which plays tribute to abstract geometric art, whilst the big repetitive stripes on the patio evoke the work of the Support-Surface group, a well known presence in Nîmes. The design is linked to the music roots evident in the choice of vintage furnishings redolent of the 1960s in the restaurant and the performers apartments. Culturally rich, Tetrarcs project has also been retained in the precision of its planning: the different entrances (public, administration, performers, materials) are clearly separated; the halls are served directly from the vast foyer opening onto the patio, the sales area for associated products, the cloakroom and the radio studio; the three stages are directly connected and on the level of a single loading bay for the lorries that supply the equipment... and the activity on the floor of the immense concrete square draws the eyes of the storm towards the big retention pond. After The Factory in Nantes, Tetrarc is diving into its rocker past to make Paloma rock.

item.title: Sky Arte Branding
item.description: Client: Sky Arte Italy - Angelsign (Agency) After winning a really competitive pitch, we did this branding pack for Sky Arte TV Channel. Sky Arte is an Italian digital satellite television dedicated to literature, design, photography, music, festivals, shorts, video art, fashion, painting, sculture, videogames, graphic art, etc.
item.content:encoded: Client: Sky Arte Italy - Angelsign (Agency) After winning a really competitive pitch, we did this branding pack for Sky Arte TV Channel. Sky Arte is an Italian digital satellite television dedicated to literature, design, photography, music, festivals, shorts, video art, fashion, painting, sculture, videogames, graphic art, etc.
